articles.title: Gil Bashe’s healing the sick care system
articles.description: Gil Bashe discusses Healing the Sick Care System: Why People Matter, urging global health systems to restore empathy, purpose and patient-centred care
articles.content: The first thing that strikes you about Gil Bashe is that he does not speak about healthcare as a distant policy expert. He speaks as a medic, a father, a business leader and, above all, as someone who has lived inside the system he critiques. In Hyde... [3506 chars]

articles.title: Women and the middle classes dominate take-up of weight loss jabs
articles.description: Women and the middle classes are dominating take-up of weight loss injections, research suggests. Analysis of private prescriptions for drugs like Mounjaro show...
articles.content:
Women and the middle classes are dominating take-up of weight loss injections, research suggests.

articles.title: Lindora Appoints JJ Virgin as Chief Metabolic Health Officer to Lead Proprietary “Muscle-First: Everything Else Follows” Programming

articles.title: University of Auckland discovery offers hope for lymphoedema treatment
articles.description: University of Auckland scientists have made a breakthrough that could lead to effective treatments for lymphoedema, a painful swelling condition for which there is currently no cure. Lymphoedema can be congenital or caused by an injury, but it mostly occurs as an unintended consequence following breast-cancer treatment. It occurs when the lymphatic system, which moves […]
articles.content:

articles.description: Doctors explain why flu cases remain high, who’s most at risk and how to protect yourself this season.

articles.title: Experts cast doubt on the benefit of exercise for arthritis patients
articles.description: A new study questions the ‘universal promotion’ of physical activity for people with the condition
articles.content:
Physical activity may have little to no impact on alleviating the symptoms of a common form of arthritis, a new study has suggested.
Researchers behind the findings have questioned the "universal promotion" of exercise for individuals living with the... [2296 chars]

articles.title: NHS backs new diabetes drugs to cut early deaths by 17,000
articles.description: In a transformation of treatment, millions more type 2 patients will be offered flozins or GLP-1 injections such as Mounjaro and Ozempic
articles.content:
Research shows diabetes patients on SGLT-2 inhibitors are 24 per cent less likely to die early. Nice said the recommendation would prevent 17,000 deaths over the next three years in the UK.
More NHS patients with type 2 diabetes will be offered GLP-1... [2442 chars]

articles.title: Middle-class women aged 30-50 are main buyers of weight-loss drugs
articles.description: Those in wealthy areas are more likely to use products such as Wegovy and Mounjaro despite lower obesity rates
